items.description: Provides InSAR displacement data provided in the satellite Line-of-Sight, with annotated geo-localisation and quality measures per measurement point. The dataset is generated from the interferometric analysis of Sentinel-1 radar images at full resolution (20x5 m).   EGMS Basic is visualised as a vector map of measurement points colour-coded by average line-of-sight velocity and distributed to users in comma-separated values format. Each point is associated with a time series of displacement, i.e. a plot with values of displacement per acquisition of the satellite. The dataset is generated for both ascending and descending orbits.

items.description: The Burnt Area products map burn scars, surfaces which have been sufficiently affected by fire to display significant changes in the vegetation cover (destruction of dry material, reduction or loss of green material) and in the ground surface (temporarily darker because of ash). Daily products are available at global scale in the spatial resolution of 300 m and cover the period from July 2023 to present.

items.title: Burnt Area 2019 - present (raster 300 m), global, monthly - version 3.1

items.description: Satellite interferometry offers detailed, local-scale measurements (up to tens of kilometres) that are relative to specific spatial references, while global navigation satellite system (GNSS) provides absolute spatial data over larger extents. Utilizing the synergistic capabilities of satellite interferometry and GNSS, EGMS provides high-resolution local measurements across a broad spatial scale. The GNSS velocity model is derived from 4716 GNSS stations around Europe using state of the art geodetic methodologies. It is a 50-km gridded model that it is delivered as comma-separated values file. Each grid cell is identified by latitude and longitude coordinates and by the values of the three components of the velocity with their quality parameters.

items.title: European Ground Motion Service: GNSS model (vector), Europe, 2-yearly

items.description: The EGMS Ortho exploits the information provided by ascending and descending orbits of the EGMS Calibrated to derive two further layers; one of purely vertical displacements (EGMS Ortho Vertical), the other of purely east-west displacements (EGMS Ortho East/West). Both layers are resampled to a 100 m grid, so that the final resolution is 100 by 100 m. EGMS Ortho is visualised as a vector map of measurement points colour-coded by average velocity (vertical or east-west components) and distributed to users in comma-separated values format. Each point is associated with a time series of displacement, i.e. a plot with values of displacement per acquisition of the satellite.

items.title: Gross Primary Production 2023-present (raster 300 m), global, 10-daily – version 1

items.description: Contains the same type of information as the EGMS Basic, but the measurement points are referenced to a model derived from global navigation satellite system data. This dataset is generated from the interferometric analysis of Sentinel-1 radar images at full resolution (20x5 m). EGMS Calibrated is visualised as a vector map of measurement points, colour-coded by average velocity, and distributed to users in comma-separated values format. Each point is associated with a time series of displacement, i.e. a plot with values of displacement per acquisition of the satellite. The dataset is generated for both ascending and descending orbits.

The data at global level are updated in the first quarter of each year. The data are available from 2023 to the present at about 300 m spatial resolution.
